title: [BUG] Error when trying to access a specific experiment
body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)
for information on what types of issues we address. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

Please fill in this template and do not delete it unless you are sure your issue is outside its scope.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.2.0
- **Python version**: 2.7.15 and 3.6.8
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**: Try to access a specific experiment on http://127.0.0.1:5000

### Describe the problem
Describe the problem clearly here. Include descriptions of the expected behavior and the actual behavior.
When I try to access a specific experiment on http://127.0.0.1:5000 (after initializing mlflow ui), I get the error page "Oops! Something went wrong.".

### Code to reproduce issue
Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.
This error just happens when I try to access one of my experiments. The others work fine.

### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks,
please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.
The log message is as follows:
2019/10/18 13:04:53 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/runs/search [POST]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/amanda/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2446, in wsgi_app
    response = self.full_dispatch_request()
  File "/home/amanda/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1951, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
  File "/home/amanda/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1820, in handle_user_exception
    reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
  File "/home/amanda/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1949, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/home/amanda/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1935, in dispatch_request
    return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 101, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 333, in _search_runs
    max_results, order_by, page_token)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mlflow/store/abstract_store.py", line 235, in search_runs
    order_by, page_token)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mlflow/store/file_store.py", line 587, in _search_runs
    run_infos = self._list_run_infos(experiment_id, run_view_type)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mlflow/store/file_store.py", line 567, in _list_run_infos
    run_info = self._get_run_info(r_id)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mlflow/store/file_store.py", line 414, in _get_run_info
    run_info = _read_persisted_run_info_dict(meta)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mlflow/store/file_store.py", line 65, in _read_persisted_run_info_dict
    dict_copy = run_info_dict.copy()
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'copy'
